org.gerstner.oauth2android.exception
Class OAuthException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          org.gerstner.oauth2android.exception.OAuthException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
InvalidClientException, InvalidGrantException, InvalidRequestException, InvalidScopeException, UnauthorizedClientException, UnsupportedGrantTypeException
public class OAuthException
extends java.lang.Exception

Parent class for all OAuth 2.0 specific exceptions.
OAuth 2.0 exceptions have three additional parameters for error handling:

  • error - name of the error that occured, e.g. invalid_client
  • error description - an human readable description of the error, given by the server
  • error uri - uri directing to a human readable webpage for futher description of the error
In case of the UnauthorizedClientException the error decription should contain the servers "WWW-Authorization"-Header, if one was issued. This header gives specfic information on which authorization the server expects.

Author:
Christoph Gerstner
See Also:
InvalidClientException, InvalidGrantException, InvalidRequestException, InvalidScopeException, UnauthorizedClientException, UnsupportedGrantTypeException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

error

private java.lang.String error
Short description or name of the occured error. (REQUIRED)

See Also:
errorDescription, errorUri

errorDescription

private java.lang.String errorDescription
Human readable description returned by the server to be shown to the user. (OPTIONAL)

See Also:
error, errorUri

errorUri

private java.lang.String errorUri
Uri leading to a human readable webpage with further information to the occured error. The client may choose to redirect the user to this page. (OPTIONAL)

See Also:
error, errorDescription
